{"body": {"name": "Lava Network - Decentralizing and Upgrading rpc.near.org", "summary": "Lava successfully manages 50% of rpc.near.org traffic and is ready to quickly scale to 100%. Lava is trusted by top NEAR teams like Ref, Burrow, Bitte & Pagoda\\\\nWith proven experience operating public endpoints for Axelar, Cosmos & Evmos Lava\\\\\\'s decentralized stack ensures high performance by aggregating top providers like Liquify and Chainstack, and community contributors\\\\nLava will offer discounts on multi-chain APIs to accelerate the transition to a demo environment and support Chain Abstraction", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": 2, "description": "## Introduction\\\\nrpc.near.org serves as the primary gateway into NEAR for new users and developers. As NEAR continues to grow rapidly, it\\\\u{2019}s crucial to ensure that rpc.near.org provides a smooth and reliable onboarding experience, while funneling advanced users to production-grade services.\\\\n\\\\nLava\\\\u{2019}s decentralized approach to public RPC enhances speed and reliability, drives user engagement and maximizes retention. It\\\\u{2019}s highly scalable and robust, engaging by a large network of professional teams like Nodies, Liquify, All That Node, Chainstack and community contributors.\\\\n\\\\n**Lava is the primary RPC provider for NEAR, achieving significant milestones this year:**\\\\n- Managing 50% of the traffic on rpc.near.org\\\\n- Serving 233,000 unique daily users on NEAR\\\\n- Handling over 43 billion NEAR RPC requests, 10B every month\\\\n- Powering leading dApps such as: Ref Finance, Burrow Finance, Bitte Protocol, Meteor, NEAR Mobile, Sender, Dragonbot, SHITZU, Allstake and more\\\\n\\\\n**Performance**:\\\\n- 100% uptime in the last 6 months\\\\n- 185ms average latency across all regions\\\\n\\\\n![https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiai44wnbwgqlwz373446j5giz43tn7do4u7vcfbhlfkjuozqp76ve](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiai44wnbwgqlwz373446j5giz43tn7do4u7vcfbhlfkjuozqp76ve)\\\\n\\\\n**Unique features:**\\\\n- **0 Errors for developers** - automatic fallback and retry before errors reach the end user\\\\n- **Faster TX execution** - transactions are sent to many providers at once, resulting in faster propagation and execution for end users\\\\n- **Instant responses** on common and recent requests through smart cache\\\\n-** Super reliable and robust** - aggregating top RPC providers on a single endpoint\\\\n- **Public stats page** - showing health, usage and performance metrics, \\\\n\\\\nOur goal is to transition rpc.near.org into a super reliable demo environment that maximizes dev retention, while smoothly funneling heavy users to purchase API subscriptions.\\\\n\\\\n## Solution Overview\\\\n### Decentralized RPC\\\\nLava is a decentralized network of RPC providers with quality of service and reliability assurances. Access is available through one aggregated endpoint or directly using a consumer service open to all:\\\\nUsers who access NEAR through Lava get the best providers in their geolocation, based on uptime, latency, and data freshness.\\\\nProviders that operate on Lava are rewarded in NEAR based on their volume of requests and quality of service.\\\\n\\\\nOur solution will combine RPC nodes for real-time data and transactions and ReadRPC for historical data.\\\\n\\\\n### Transition to Demo Environment\\\\nUsers exceeding rate limits will be redirected to Lava\\\\u{2019}s Gateway (and NEAR Docs), where they can purchase API subscriptions. Lava\\\\u{2019}s subscriptions include NEAR and 30+ other networks, making it very attractive for developers interested in using NEAR for Chain Abstraction.\\\\n\\\\nBy offering special discounts on multi-chain data access, Lava will accelerate rpc.near.org\\\\u{2019}s transition to a demo environment and NEAR\\\\u{2019}s alignment with Chain Abstraction.\\\\n\\\\n*A note about rate-limits: we recommend setting the final rate-limit to be 15-20 req/sec per IP rather than 3 req/sec as proposed in the RFP.*\\\\n\\\\n### Security\\\\n**1. Security Measures:**\\\\n- Comprehensive DDoS protection via Cloudflare, IP whitelisting, and 95-day log retention with detailed monitoring.\\\\n- 24/7 proactive monitoring and response team to ensure 100% uptime and quick incident management.\\\\n\\\\n**2. Disaster Recovery Plan**:\\\\n- Our globally distributed infrastructure, with servers strategically placed across multiple regions, ensures minimized downtime and complete mitigation of outages. Each region is equipped with failover load balancing, providing seamless service continuity even during localized failures. Regular backups further reinforce our ability to restore services quickly and efficiently, always ensuring uninterrupted operation.\\\\n\\\\n**3. Compliance and Data Integrity**:\\\\n- Adherence to data consistency standards, with transparent communication during service changes or disruptions. Our infrastructure ensures high security and compliance.\\\\n- Lava\\\\u{2019}s RPC serves five-time epochs and tracks all NEAR shards. It also offers an advanced data integrity mechanism that samples and cross-references RPC responses to detect and prevent inaccurate data.\\\\n\\\\n### Service Level Agreement\\\\n**Our current services meet the RFP requirements with**:\\\\n- Uptime: 100% over the last 6 months\\\\n- Average latency: 185ms across all regions\\\\n\\\\n**To further improve our SLA, we will**:\\\\n- Onboard more top providers\\\\n- Integrate readrpc\\\\n- Deploy additional gateways\\\\n\\\\n### Support\\\\nWe currently support the NEAR community through both public and private channels. We will happily set up dedicated support channels for NEAR <> Lava users. We aim to respond to issues significantly faster than the standard 24-48 hour timeframe.\\\\n\\\\n**Bitte**:\\\\n*\\\\\\\"Since integrating Lava RPC, we have seen a significant improvement in the performance of Mintbase Wallet, resulting in fewer user complaints. The support from the Lava team has been exceptional, with their quick responses making a real difference.\\\\\\\"*\\\\n\\\\n**Dragonbot**:\\\\n*\\\\\\\"We\\\\u{2019}ve been using Lava for our trading bot and were pleasantly surprised by the performance and low integration cost. Switching from our previous provider to Lava proved to be a great decision. Their support team has consistently been available to address any issues, often going above and beyond to implement fixes, even on weekends.\\\\\\\"*\\\\n\\\\n### Updates and Changes\\\\nLava will update its RPC specifications in line with nearcore updates, and collaborate with providers to ensure smooth upgrades.\\\\n\\\\n### Transparent status page\\\\nLava will provide an openly available real-time status page where anyone can monitor the health and usage stats of rpc.near.org - including availability, performance, geolocation distribution, common queries, rate-limit enforcement, dapp usage, and the transition from public to private RPC.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nA sneak preview of the new dashboard :)\\\\n\\\\n![https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreie2ch35rz5k5pq7eenxndy67py2qllhu7chsowcruz7feauxjpg7m](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreie2ch35rz5k5pq7eenxndy67py2qllhu7chsowcruz7feauxjpg7m)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n![https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreidg52g7etbckr2dksubku5ei6yiml653oavva3px23ygfnfad2ymq](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreidg52g7etbckr2dksubku5ei6yiml653oavva3px23ygfnfad2ymq)\\\\n\\\\n## Budget \\\\n**Total budget - $336,000 (in NEAR) for the first year**\\\\n1. Transition and Setup - $15,000\\\\n- Transfer and testing of rpc.near.org\\\\n- Adding ReadRPC to Lava\\\\n- Onboarding more top providers\\\\n- Deploying additional servers for redundancy\\\\n- Statistics dashboard\\\\n- User and provider docs\\\\n2. Infrastructure & maintenance - $35,000 / month until February, $20,000 / month from February with the new rate-limits\\\\n- RPC providers - goes back to the NEAR community\\\\n- ReadRPC providers - goes back to the NEAR community\\\\n- Hardware\\\\n- Devops\\\\n3. Support: 3,000$ / month\\\\n- User support\\\\n- Provider support\\\\n\\\\n## Milestones\\\\n1. Milestone 1 (October 2024): Signing of agreement\\\\n2. Milestone 2 (November 2024): Inheriting rpc.near.org operations\\\\n- **Quick transition. From 50% of traffic handled by Lava to 100% in a few days**\\\\n- Knowledge transfer including ReadRPC\\\\n- Onboard top providers\\\\n- Launch marketing campaign\\\\n- Launch public statistics dashboard\\\\n3. Milestone 3 (February 2025): Transitioning rpc.near.org to a demo environment\\\\n- Multi-chain API subscriptions campaign\\\\n- Complete rate-limit roadmap\\\\n\\\\n### Contingency\\\\nOur pricing uses Compute Units, which range from 10 to 200 according to the intensity and resources required to perform different queries. Looking at our current NEAR usage, the average multiplier is 16.34 CUs/Query.\\\\n\\\\n$0.1 for every 1 million monthly Compute Units beyond 425 billion, which are about ~26B requests, equal to an entire month of 10,000RPS.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Metrics\\\\nWe will track the following metrics to measure success across two key areas:\\\\n1. Quality of service\\\\n- Uptime\\\\n- Latency\\\\n- Data freshness\\\\n- Success rate\\\\n2. Transition to demo environment\\\\n- Total traffic\\\\n- Active users\\\\n- 429 Errors\\\\n- Referred traffic from rpc.near.org to gateway.lavanet.xyz and https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/providers (UTMs)\\\\n- Subscription purchases\\\\n\\\\n## Organization\\\\nLava Foundation is a non-profit entity representing Lava\\\\u{2019}s token holders and DAO, leading the vision and development of Lava Network. Our specialized team offers vast experience in Web3 strategy, growth, marketing, and leading the vision and blockchain development. The Foundation collaborates with Magma Devs, a team of world-class builders and ex-founders. We\\\\u{2019}re already in the process of hiring ex-Pagoda SRE engineers.\\\\n\\\\n**Primary contact: Yuval Binder, BD Lead at Magma Devs**\\\\nTotal size of teams: Lava Foundation (6), Magma Devs (25)\\\\nTotal engineerings: 22\\\\nTeam location: Global\\\\n\\\\n**Amir Aaronson - Head of Lava Foundation**\\\\nAmir has extensive experience in strategic oversight and innovation in technology enterprises. He has been active in the blockchain space since 2017 and up until recently served as the head of the foundation at Beam \\\\n\\\\n**Omer Mishael - CTO at Lava Foundation**\\\\nOmer specializes in RPC, consensus building, Layer 1 protocols, software design, and development.\\\\n\\\\n**Ethan Luc - Head of Marketing at Lava Foundation**\\\\nEthan has previously managed the digital growth of hundreds of small and medium companies spending millions in quarterly marketing spend, and advising multiple blockchain startups on their go-to-market. Before Lava, he was building an NFT marketplace using social graphs for community discovery.\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n**Portfolio of Relevant Work:**\\\\nLava has 3 years of experience building and maintaining robust RPC systems for blockchains and enterprises, specializing in boosting ecosystem-wide user experiences.\\\\n\\\\nOur customers and partners include NEAR, Starknet, Filecoin, Union, Axelar, Evmos, Cosmos and many more will be announced soon.\\\\n\\\\nAs the official RPC provider for Axelar, Evmos and Cosmos Hub, we\\\\u{2019}ve maintained 100% uptime over the last 6 months, and an average latency of 170ms at high-throughput environments.\\\\n\\\\nhttps://x.com/lavanetxyz/status/1823373406513090669\\\\nhttps://x.com/lavanetxyz/status/1832092166773944745\\\\n\\\\n### NEAR Experience\\\\nLava is the go-to RPC service in the ecosystem, chosen by leading teams like Pagoda, Ref & Burrow, Bitte, Meteor, NEAR Mobile, Dragonbot, Sender Wallet, Allstake and more\\\\nThrough close collaboration with NEAR Foundation and Pagoda, and by leveraging Lava\\\\\\'s decentralized tech, we have significantly enhanced the reliability of on-chain activities. \\\\n\\\\n### Key Examples:\\\\n**Solving \\\\\\'node does not track shard-id\\\\\\' errors**\\\\nLava implemented a retry mechanism that automatically redirects queries to alternative providers when failures occur. This solution greatly increased transaction success rates and minimized errors that affected all RPC services on NEAR, degrading critical services like Meteor Wallet.\\\\n\\\\n**Boosting Ref Finance latency and loading times**\\\\nBy identifying and caching the most crucial API calls for app.ref.finance, we dramatically improved user experience and loading times.\\\\n\\\\n### In-house resources\\\\n- Design UX/UI\\\\n- Project management\\\\n- Customer Support\\\\n- BD and marketing\\\\n\\\\n### Testimonials\\\\n**Daniel - CPO at Altiplanic, Evmos:**\\\\n*\\\\u{201c}Lava has been a valuable partner in offering public RPC endpoints on Evmos. Their innovative approach of decentralizing RPC endpoints via incentivization has notably improved the stability, quality, and visibility or RPC services on the Evmos chain. We appreciate Lava for their significant contributions to the project\\\\u{2019}s success.\\\\u{201d}*\\\\n\\\\n**Ref Finance:**\\\\n*\\\\u{201c}Lava has been a crucial partner for Ref and Burrow Finance. We rely on their endpoint as the default RPC for our products and have been extremely satisfied with their performance, stability, and support. Since integrating Lava, we\\\\u{2019}ve experienced a noticeable reduction in errors.\\\\\\\"*\\\\n\\\\n**Bitte:**\\\\n*\\\\\\\"Since integrating Lava RPC, we have seen a significant improvement in the performance of Mintbase Wallet, resulting in fewer user complaints. The support from the Lava team has been exceptional, with their quick responses making a real difference.\\\\\\\"*\\\\n\\\\n**Dragonbot:**\\\\n*\\\\\\\"We\\\\u{2019}ve been using Lava for our trading bot and were pleasantly surprised by the performance and low integration cost. Switching from our previous provider to Lava proved to be a great decision. Their support team has consistently been available to address any issues, often going above and beyond to implement fixes, even on weekends.\\\\\\\"*\\\\n\\\\n**ShardDog:**\\\\n*\\\\u{201c}At ShardDog, Lava has quickly become an important piece within our tech stack. As usage grows but we stay as a small team, we need reliable infra to handle the scaling. Since adding this to our front-end and back-end APIs, it has allowed us to focus on improving our product instead of the infrastructure.\\\\\\\"*\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "8d51039cd656f1d9716894420b62555b68022797e7214adf4f630c77caf1cf66", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "336000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": []}
